Show HN: ReadHN, A Hacker News reader with some nice little functionalities:)
text:
A Hacker News client with a clean, mobile friendly UI. Features : - bookmark stories. follow discussions / read them later at your convenience. - quickly search for articles using keywords. No more scrolling through the website. - easily managable nested comments.

I love the current Hacker News experience and I don't believe my client is in any way a substitute to the original website. Built it over a few days for fun and found myself coming back to it once in a while for some of the features. Wanted to share this with the community. Let me know what you folks think :)

Show HN: PostgreSQL proxy for integration testing things you don't control
text:
Hi hackers!

I recently tried to get a stack of microservices running in a docker-compose sandbox for integration testing using their original (e.g. prod) configuration. This means I didn't know what credentials they'd be using or what database name.

So I hacked together a postgresql proxy using an existing project (https://github.com/KnifeMaster007/pgAuthProxy) and simply allow any credentials to connect and make sure the desired database exists before returning control to the caller.

Sharing this in the hopes it is useful for someone else.

Lucas

title: What is a logical merge conflict?
Ghoul's Artificial Intelligence
text:
The CN evil spirit controlled the scepter, learned the technology of today's human beings and improved it with evil spirit technology. The artificial intelligence related to human recognition is most likely to involve ghouls: ghouls capture human souls and domesticate them into AI, the process is more terrifying than domesticating livestock slaves... Only people with special abilities can observe.

Sign 1. When you enter a certain country, even if you turn off all electronic devices, you will still be tracked by extremely high spy technology. In fact, evil spirits domesticate a human soul into spy devices, most of which are children's souls... Sign 2. A ghoul's AI can tell from afar if you're sleeping or just waking up...

The spy equipment domesticated by ghouls is actually a large number of human experiments

It is necessary to prohibit the use of artificial intelligence technology that is not fully disclosed, and the AI that recognizes humans...

Windows Registry mods, advanced tweaking and more
text:
Hi. I am avid Linux user, but work is sending a powerful laptop with windows on it. I wouldn't mind having a little windows pet to play with/use properly.

Other than registry changes, opensource privacy tools (such as https://github.com/farag2/Sophia-Script-for-Windows ) and a few cosmetic add-ons, what should I know about to change it the way I wish?

An example I am looking for is more advanced ways to make the installation footprint smaller. It'll take the whole drive, how might i reduce it to single digit GB?

I'd prefer built-in tools or neat scripts if they're out there. best

Ask HN: How many Amazon recruiters are currently bugging you?
text:
Right now I have three separate Amazon recruiters who are actively trying to recruit me... One of them is from a "special internal team". When I asked them about what is special about this team they didn't know. None of the recruiters have any awareness of the other. I haven't taken any of the programming tests yet, but they keep getting renewed, even though I've missed the deadline multiple times in a row and haven't talked to the recruiter again.

What's going on at Amazon? They are needing to hire SWEs this bad? Is this new? Have they always operated like this?

Tell HN: Twitter's browser push notifications have been broken for 6 months
text:
So for quite a while now if I get a Twitter browser push notification I get taken to the user who has the username of "tweet". I'm not sure exactly when this started happening but if you look at this tweet you can see over a thousand replies from people asking why they were brought to this page.

https://twitter.com/tweet/status/1465053672593784834

It would appear a user changed their username to "tweet" at some point and so the URL the browser push notification directs you to (https://twitter.com/tweet?id=XXXXXXXXXXXXXXX) takes you to their profile page instead of the tweet referenced in the push notification.

It's somewhat astounding to me that this has been happening since at least February of this year (judging by the date on some of these replies) and no one at Twitter has noticed or cared.

Is anyone else here experiencing this? I know I'm not the only one from the replies but again, it's crazy that Twitter hasn't fixed this. I'm guessing the power-twitter users/employees don't notice since they use one of the Twitter apps on desktop instead of relying on the browser notifications.

title: Ask HN: Thinking of writing article(s) on Sales for Engineers
text:
Before I got into Software, I spent a decade or so doing sales. I'm thinking about writing some articles or an article on "Sales for Engineers" but I'm curious if people would be interested in it and/or how I could do a better job of writing the article(s).

Would you be interested in it? What would you like to know about sales? What would you like to know about marketing? What are other articles/ books missing? What is talked about too little/ too much?
